user.title: Add your Anker Solix devices
user.description: Enter credentials for your Anker cloud account

data.accept_terms: Accept Integration usage terms and conditions

data_description.username: Recommendation: Create a second account in the Anker App and share your system with the second account. A parallel usage of the same account in this integration and the Anker App is not possible.
data_description.accept_terms:
The user bears the sole risk for a possible loss of the manufacturer's warranty or any damage caused by use of the integration. A consent automatically includes future updates, which can extend the integration functionality.
Further information: {terms_link}

reauth_confirm.title: Change your configured account
reauth_confirm.description: Enter credentials for your Anker cloud account

data.accept_terms: Accept Integration usage terms and conditions

data_description.username: Recommendation: Create a second account in the Anker App and share your system with the second account. A parallel usage of the same account in this integration and the Anker App is not possible.
data_description.accept_terms:
The user bears the sole risk for a possible loss of the manufacturer's warranty or any damage caused by use of the integration. A consent automatically includes future updates, which can extend the integration functionality.
Further information: {terms_link}

data_description.exclude: Depending on excluded entity categories, the number of Api requests can be reduced (especially for energy categories)

api_options.name: Api options
api_options.description: Modify options for Anker power cloud server Api

data_description.scan_interval: Note: The data on the cloud server is updated every 60-300 seconds at most if no MQTT real-time data update has been triggered. An update interval of less than 60 seconds therefore only offers advantages in conjunction with MQTT use.
data_description.endpoint_limit: Note: The Anker cloud Api enforces a request limit per minute and endpoint. To avoid Api errors, identical endpoint requests are throttled to 10 per minute once the limit has been exceeded. With 0 you can deactivate endpoint throttling.
data_description.skip_invalid: Note: Cloud responses with invalid or stale data will make entities unavailable. You can skip entity updates until next valid data is received again.

mqtt_options.name: MQTT options
mqtt_options.description: Modify options for Anker MQTT server usage

data_description.mqtt_usage:
Note: MQTT usage may enable additional entities and controls for your owned devices. This heavily depends on known MQTT message decoding of your device.
Further information: {mqtt_link}
data_description.trigger_timeout: Devices publish real time data only if triggered. The timeout is the publish duration if not triggered again.

test_options.name: Test options
test_options.description: Modify options for testing the integration

data.testfolder: Folder with json files for integration testing
data.mqtt_test_speed: Speed factor for MQTT message simulation

data_description.testmode: In test mode, the configuration only uses the json files in the selected folder to create devices and sensors for test purposes. Server communication then no longer takes place.
data_description.mqtt_test_speed: If the folder contains a sequence of MQTT message files, these are simulated using the selected speed factor.

error.connection: Unable to connect to the server: {error_detail}
error.duplicate_devices: {username} has shared devices with existing account {shared_account} configured in hub {name}, you cannot configure both hubs at the same time!
error.accept_terms: Usage terms and conditions must be accepted

data_description.exclude: Depending on excluded entity categories, the number of Api requests can be reduced (especially for energy categories)

api_options.name: Api options
api_options.description: Modify options for Anker power cloud server Api

data_description.scan_interval: Note: The data on the cloud server is updated every 60-300 seconds at most if no MQTT real-time data update has been triggered. An update interval of less than 60 seconds therefore only offers advantages in conjunction with MQTT use.
data_description.endpoint_limit: Note: The Anker cloud Api enforces a request limit per minute and endpoint. To avoid Api errors, identical endpoint requests are throttled to 10 per minute once the limit has been exceeded. With 0 you can deactivate endpoint throttling.
data_description.skip_invalid: Note: Cloud responses with invalid or stale data will make entities unavailable. You can skip entity updates until next valid data is received again.

mqtt_options.name: MQTT options
mqtt_options.description: Modify options for Anker MQTT server usage

data_description.mqtt_usage:
Note: MQTT usage may enable additional entities and controls for your owned devices. This heavily depends on known MQTT message decoding of your device.
Further information: {mqtt_link}
data_description.trigger_timeout: Devices publish real time data only if triggered. The timeout is the publish duration if not triggered again.

test_options.name: Test options
test_options.description: Modify options for testing the integration

data.testfolder: Folder with json files for integration testing
data.mqtt_test_speed: Speed factor for MQTT message simulation

data_description.testmode: In test mode, the configuration only uses the json files in the selected folder to create devices and sensors for test purposes. Server communication then no longer takes place.
data_description.mqtt_test_speed: If the folder contains a sequence of MQTT message files, these are simulated using the selected speed factor.

duplicate_devices.description: {username} has shared devices with existing account {shared_account} configured in hub {name}, you cannot configure both hubs at the same time!
duplicate_devices.title: Duplicate Anker Solix device serials found

get_system_info.name: Request actual system information
get_system_info.description: The actual system information will be provided as response to this action

include_cache.name: Include cache
include_cache.description: Include cache to merge existing system data from Api cache and new data from the scene_info query

export_systems.name: Export anonymized Api information of accessible systems and devices into zipped JSON files
export_systems.description: The actual Api responses for your Anker Solix system and device information will be anonymized and saved into JSON files. The zipped output folder will be returned as response. This action can run 10 seconds or several minutes if endpoint throttling is being applied! The Execute button toggles just green once finished.

include_mqtt.name: Include MQTT messages
include_mqtt.description:
Standard MQTT messages may have intervals of several minutes and therefore the export will run above 5 minutes.
Note: Other device serials in binary MQTT data cannot be anonymized.

get_solarbank_schedule.name: Request actual Solarbank schedule
get_solarbank_schedule.description: The actual Solarbank schedule will be provided as response to this action

clear_solarbank_schedule.name: Clear the Solarbank schedule
clear_solarbank_schedule.description: The Solarbank schedule will be cleared

sb2_fields.name: Solarbank 2+ options
sb2_fields.description: For Solarbank 2+ systems you can specify following options (ignored for Solarbank 1)

plan.name: Plan
plan.description: Select plan to be modified, plan for active usage mode is the default

week_days.name: Weekdays
week_days.description: Select weekdays to be removed from schedule

set_solarbank_schedule.name: Set a new Solarbank Schedule
set_solarbank_schedule.description: Create a new time schedule for the Solarbank with the defined time interval. An existing time schedule is completely replaced by the new interval!

sb1_fields.name: Solarbank 1 options
sb1_fields.description: For Solarbank 1 systems you can specify following options (ignored for Solarbank 2+)

sb2_fields.name: Solarbank 2+ options
sb2_fields.description: For Solarbank 2+ systems you can specify following options (ignored for Solarbank 1)

start_time.name: Start time
start_time.description: Start time of the interval (seconds are ignored)

end_time.name: End time
end_time.description: End time of the interval (seconds are ignored). For 24:00 you must enter 23:59

plan.name: Plan
plan.description: Select plan to be modified, plan for active usage mode is the default (ignored for Solarbank 1)

week_days.name: Weekdays
week_days.description: Weekdays for the defined time interval (ignored for Solarbank 1)

appliance_load.name: Home load preset
appliance_load.description: Watt to be delivered to the house by all devices

device_load.name: Device load preset
device_load.description: Watt to be delivered by the device. Optional for dual solarbank systems with individual device presets (ignored for Solarbank 2+)

allow_export.name: Allow export
allow_export.description: If deactivated, the battery is not discharged or, if an MI80 inverter or 0 W switch is installed, the charging priority is used without exporting power to the house (ignored for Solarbank 2+)

discharge_priority.name: Discharge priority
discharge_priority.description: If activated, battery discharge will be prioritized for export and possible PV production will be stopped (ignored for Solarbank 2+)

charge_priority_limit.name: Limit for charge priority
charge_priority_limit.description: The charging priority is used up to the set charge level when the MI80 inverter is set. Setting is ignored if no 0 W switch is installed or no MI80 inverter is set or for Solarbank 2+.

update_solarbank_schedule.name: Update Solarbank Schedule
update_solarbank_schedule.description: An existing Solarbank schedule is updated with the defined time interval. Adjacent time intervals are adjusted in time and overlapping ones are replaced.

sb1_fields.name: Solarbank 1 options
sb1_fields.description: For Solarbank 1 systems you can specify following options (ignored for Solarbank 2+)

sb2_fields.name: Solarbank 2+ options
sb2_fields.description: For Solarbank 2+ systems you can specify following options (ignored for Solarbank 1)

start_time.name: Start time
start_time.description: Start time of the interval (seconds are ignored)

end_time.name: End time
end_time.description: End time of the interval (seconds are ignored). For 24:00 you must enter 23:59

plan.name: Plan
plan.description: Select plan to be modified, plan for active usage mode is the default (ignored for Solarbank 1)

week_days.name: Weekdays
week_days.description: Weekdays for the defined time interval (ignored for Solarbank 1)

appliance_load.name: Home load preset
appliance_load.description: Watt to be delivered to the house by all devices

device_load.name: Device load preset
device_load.description: Watt to be delivered by the device. Optional for dual solarbank systems with individual device presets (ignored for Solarbank 2+)

allow_export.name: Allow export
allow_export.description: If deactivated, the battery is not discharged or, if an MI80 inverter or 0 W switch is installed, the charging priority is used without exporting power to the house (ignored for Solarbank 2+)

discharge_priority.name: Discharge priority
discharge_priority.description: If activated, battery discharge will be prioritized for export and possible PV production will be stopped (ignored for Solarbank 2+)

charge_priority_limit.name: Limit for charge priority
charge_priority_limit.description: The charging priority is used up to the set charge level when the MI80 inverter is set. Setting is ignored if no 0 W switch is installed or no MI80 inverter is set or for Solarbank 2+.

modify_solix_backup_charge.name: Modify backup charge settings
modify_solix_backup_charge.description: Adjust the backup time for emergency AC charge of the battery (using max. AC charge power)

backup_start.name: Backup start
backup_start.description: Start date and time of the backup period in the form YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. Default is active period start or now.

backup_end.name: Backup end
backup_end.description: End date and time of the backup period in the form YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS. Default is active period end or now + 3 hours.

backup_duration.name: Backup duration
backup_duration.description: Duration of the backup period in the form HH:MM:SS. Used only if no backup end is specified instead of default duration of 3 hours.

enable_backup.name: Enable backup period
enable_backup.description: Enable or disable the defined or active backup period

modify_solix_use_time.name: Modify Time of Use plan
modify_solix_use_time.description: Adjust the Time of Use plan for Anker Solix devices that support AC charge and a Time of Use mode with flexible power tariffs

start_month.name: Start month
start_month.description: Start month for the season to be modified

end_month.name: End month
end_month.description: End month for the season to be modified

day_type.name: Day type
day_type.description: Type of days to be modified in the season

start_hour.name: Start hour
start_hour.description: Start hour of day type to be modified (minutes and seconds are ignored)

end_hour.name: End hour
end_hour.description: End hour of day type to be modified (minutes and seconds are ignored). For 24:00 you must enter 23:59

tariff.name: Tariff
tariff.description: Tariff to be used for the selected or active period

tariff_price.name: Tariff price per kWh
tariff_price.description: Tariff price per kWh for the selected or active period

delete.name: Delete selected options from plan
delete.description: If activated, the selected options will be removed from the plan instead of being created or modified. Deletions will always merge ranges in the applicable scope to avoid any gaps. If no option is selected, the whole plan will be deleted.

api_request.name: Api request
api_request.description:
Issue a request to an Anker Solix Api endpoint with optional payload parameters.
REMINDER: The user bears the sole risk for a possible loss of the manufacturer's warranty or any damage caused by use of the integration or this Anker Solix Api request action.

method.name: Method
method.description: Select type of request to be issued (most endpoints require the post method)

endpoint.name: Endpoint
endpoint.description: Select or define the endpoint where the request should be sent to (known endpoints are documented in https://github.com/thomluther/ha-anker-solix/blob/main/custom_components/anker_solix/solixapi/apitypes.py#L98)

payload.name: Payload
payload.description: Optional object with parameter value pairs or list depending on endpoint. Typical parameters are `site_id` or `device_sn`, but parameter names can vary. Some request error messages may reveal required parameter names and format.

increase_blocked.message: {entity_id} cannot be increased to {value} because minimum change delay of {delay} seconds is not passed

out_of_range.message: {entity_id} cannot be set to {value} because it is outside of allowed range {min}-{max}

active_testmode.message: {entity_id} cannot be used while configuration is running in testmode

apiusage_deactivated.message: {entity_id} cannot be used for requested action {action_name} while Api usage is deactivated

shared_devices.message: {username} cannot be loaded because it shares devices with active configuration {shared_account}

active_devices.message: {device} cannot be removed because it has registered active entities

device_refresh.message: Devices for {coordinator} cannot be updated within less than {min_dev_refresh} seconds

device_refresh_active.message: Devices for {coordinator} cannot be updated while another update is still running

service_not_supported.message: The entity {entity} does not support the action {service}

mqtt_command_failed.message: The MQTT command '{command}' of {coordinator} for device {device_alias} ({device_sn}) failed

action_blocked.message: The action {service} cannot be executed again while still running or startup in progress (timeout at {timeout})
